job_title: Admissions Student Worker in Seward, NE
pros: I enjoyed my time, flexible with class schedules.
cons: Weekly hours are dependent on the number of visitors and be vary greatly.

pros: Very friendly workplace enviroment. highly recommended
cons: Must be prepared to work long hours

review_title: Great place for students to work
pros: Flexible schedule for people also taking classes
cons: There is really nothing to complain about

pros: freedom to try new projects, flexible hours
cons: frustrating meetings, lots of work, inconsistent team of staff

review_title: A good place to work, strong community
job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Seward, NE
pros: Great Location, Competitive Pay, Great Facilities
cons: Culture of Complacency, Lack of diversity

job_title: Director of Student Success in Seward, NE
pros: Autonomy, flexibility, family community, Students are driven.
cons: Pay is very low, understaffed, staunch religious components bleed into mission.

pros: My employers respond quickly to questions, work well with scheduling around classes, and provide an enjoyable atmosphere to work in.
cons: Not many hours are provided, but they work well around my busy academic schedule.
Do not get to pic what photos to post.

review_title: Staff position in recruitment and development
pros: Great Mission. The professors and staff foster an atmosphere that makes you want to work there. The students are kind and are willing to learn from everyone.
cons: The upper management (vice presidents, president, etc.) are out of touch with the actual happenings on their campus. They would rather be right than implement an idea from faculty.

review_title: Great students.  Lack of direction and leadership issues.
pros: The students are amazing and many of the people working there are amazing.  The people work very hard for their students and they believe in what they are doing.
cons: The culture is repressive and there is a general lack of respect for employees.  Administrators use intimidation and bullying to get their way and regularly threaten employees who don't comply.  Good people just "disappear" after addressing real issues in the organization including discrimination and harassment.

pros: The students are great. There are amazing faculty there and they truly believe in what they do.
cons: The administration is inept at best and unethical at worst. Never be honest with upper management or you will be fired, no matter how competent you are.

review_title: Kids Rock, Bosses Not So Much
pros: Solid vacation schedule, good internal communication with lateral co-workers
cons: Poor compensation increases, constant pressure to make recruitment goals, upper management apathy to new ideas and strategies.
